name: Aloo Mutter
history: Aloo Mutter, a staple in North Indian cuisine, is a simple yet popular dish made with potatoes (Aloo) and peas (Mutter). It's known for its comforting and homey feel, often made in Indian households.
description: Aloo Mutter is a hearty vegetarian curry featuring a flavorful combination of potatoes and green peas. Cooked in a tomato-based sauce with Indian spices, it's both comforting and satisfying.

instructions.title: Prepare the Base
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add onions and ginger-garlic paste, cooking until onions turn golden.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a minute, then add tomato puree. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.

instructions.title: Cook Potatoes and Peas
instructions.description: Add cubed potatoes and green peas to the pan. Add water to cover the vegetables. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the potatoes are tender.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Stir in garam masala and cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

tips: Ensure the potatoes are cut into even-sized pieces for uniform cooking.
Adjust the amount of chili powder to suit your taste for spiciness.
variations: Add a splash of cream or coconut milk for a richer curry.
Include other vegetables like carrots or cauliflower for more nutrition and variety.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl.
Pair with a side of yogurt or raita for a cooling effect.
